div.p: All authors assisted with the manuscript preparation. SO led the review of managed land approaches that are used by governments for reporting to the UNFCCC, and led the managed land analysis for the United States. GD and CW assisted with the review of managed land approaches and the managed land analysis for the United States. JS assisted with the managed land analysis for the United States. AS conducted the managed land analysis. WK led compilation of the managed forest lands areas in Canada, and TH led the compilation of cropland and managed grassland areas in Canada. TK and MR assisted with the managed land analysis for Brazil, particularly those in the last III National GHG Inventory (MCTI, 2016), covering the period 2002–2010. All authors read and approved the final manuscript.

sec.p: We thank Alicia Klepfer who assisted with review of the national communications in addition to a number of translators: Mikhail Yatskov, Kerry Dooley, Craig Wayson, and Ana María Planas. We also thank Tom Wirth who provided comments on a draft version of the manuscript.
The authors declare that they have no competing interests.

All national communications reviewed in this study can be accessed from the UNFCCC website (See http://unfccc.int/national_reports/annex_i_natcom/submitted_natcom/items/10138.php). The managed land area data for the United States can be accessed by contacting the US Environmental Protection Agency ( https://www.epa.gov/ghgemissions). For Canada, all cropland (except for ~ 9kha in Yukon), managed grassland and settlements south of 60 N are publicly available ( https://open.canada.ca/en). All other data presented in this report are publicly available based on the references cited. The land database from Brazil can be made available upon request to the General Coordination of Global Climate Change ( http://sirene.mcti.gov.br/).
